edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.validator

Class CourseNameValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.validator.CourseNameValidator

  • public class CourseNameValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class defines State pattern implementation for CourseNameValidator function. Four inner classes serve as possible states when parsing a Course name, with isValid method serving as the main validation check. CourseName starts in initial state, moves to letter state for 1-4 letters, then number state for exactly 3 numbers, and finally suffix state for an optional suffix letter.
    Author:
    Nick Garner

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  CourseNameValidator.InitialState
      The default state for the beginning of the Course name.
      private class  CourseNameValidator.LetterState
      Defines behavior when isValid is currently parsing letters in the course name.
      private class  CourseNameValidator.NumberState
      Defines behavior when isValid is currently parsing digits in the Course name.
      private class  CourseNameValidator.State
      Superclass for the concrete states.
      private class  CourseNameValidator.SuffixState
      Defines behavior when isValid is parsing Course name in the suffix state

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CourseNameValidator.State currentState
      Current FSM state that the name validation is in
      private int digitCount
      Running count of numbers in the number state
      private int letterCount
      Running count of letters in the letter state
      private CourseNameValidator.State stateInitial
      The default state that the FSM starts in
      private CourseNameValidator.State stateLetter
      The second FSM state, where 1-4 letters are input
      private CourseNameValidator.State stateNumber
      The third FSM state, where exactly 3 numbers are input
      private CourseNameValidator.State stateSuffix
      The final FSM state, where an optional single letter suffix can be input
      private boolean validEndState
      Boolean var to track if name has landed on a valid state to end with

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CourseNameValidator()
      Constructs a new CourseNameValidator object with reset letter and digit counts, and instantiates possible course name states.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(java.lang.String courseName)
                throws InvalidTransitionException
        Checks the given String parameter to make sure it is a valid course name.
        Parameters:
        courseName - The String to check for validity.
        Returns:
        Returns true if String is a valid name, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidTransitionException - If any character in the course name initiates a state transfer that is not allowed.
